## Personal Trainer Integration - Comprehensive Exploration

I've thoroughly explored the FitToday iOS Personal Trainer integration. Here's the complete current state:

---

## 1. PERSONALIZED WORKOUTS (PDF-BASED)

### **PersonalWorkoutsListView.swift**
- Displays a scrollable list of trainer-sent workouts as PDF/image files
- Features include:
  - Loading state with spinner
  - Empty state with "doc.text" icon
  - LazyVStack with individual workout rows
  - Pull-to-refresh capability
  - PDF viewer sheet that opens when row is tapped
  - Error alert handling
  - Dependency injection via resolver
  - Automatic PDF cache status checking

### **PersonalWorkoutsViewModel.swift** 
Manages the list of trainer workouts. Key state:
- `workouts`: Array of `PersonalWorkout` entities
- `isLoading`, `errorMessage`: Basic state flags
- `newWorkoutsCount`, `hasNewWorkouts`: Computed properties for unviewed workouts

Methods:
- `loadWorkouts(userId:)`: Fetches all workouts
- `startObserving(userId:)`: Real-time updates via AsyncStream
- `markAsViewed(_ workout:)`: Marks a workout as viewed (updates `viewedAt`)
- `getPDFURL(for:)`: Gets local URL from cache
- `isPDFCached(_:)`: Checks cache status
- Uses `@Observable` pattern with `@MainActor`

### **PersonalWorkoutRepository Protocol**
```swift
protocol PersonalWorkoutRepository: Sendable {
    func fetchWorkouts(for userId: String) async throws -> [PersonalWorkout]
    func markAsViewed(_ workoutId: String) async throws
    func observeWorkouts(for userId: String) -> AsyncStream<[PersonalWorkout]>
}
```

### **FirebasePersonalWorkoutRepository**
Implementation:
- **Firebase collection**: `personalWorkouts`
- **Query**: Filters by `userId`, orders by `createdAt` descending
- **Decoding**: Extracts trainerId, userId, title, fileURL, fileType, createdAt, viewedAt
- **observeWorkouts**: Uses Firestore snapshot listener for real-time updates
- **markAsViewed**: Updates document with server timestamp

### **PersonalWorkout Domain Entity**
```swift
struct PersonalWorkout: Identifiable, Hashable, Sendable, Codable {
    let id: String
    let trainerId: String
    let userId: String
    let title: String
    let description: String?
    let fileURL: String
    let fileType: FileType // .pdf or .image
    let createdAt: Date
    var viewedAt: Date?
    
    // Helpers
    var isNew: Bool { viewedAt == nil }
    var fileURLValue: URL?
    var formattedDate: String
    var relativeDate: String
}
```

### **PersonalWorkoutRow**
Visual display of single workout:
- File type icon (PDF in red, Image in blue) with 48x48 background
- Title with "NEW" badge if unviewed
- Description (max 2 lines)
- Relative date with clock icon
- "Offline" indicator with checkmark if cached
- Border highlights blue for new workouts

---

## 2. TRAINER CONNECTION & DISCOVERY

### **PersonalTrainerView**
Main trainer connection interface with:
- Loading state
- Feature disabled view ("Em breve")
- Find trainer section with:
  - Search button to open sheet
  - Invite code input with uppercase formatting
  - Benefits list (4 items)
- Connected trainer section showing:
  - Trainer card (expanded variant)
  - Connection status badge (colors based on active/pending/paused/cancelled)
  - Assigned workouts list (if connected)
  - Disconnect/Cancel buttons

### **PersonalTrainerViewModel**
Manages trainer connection flow:
- `currentTrainer`: The connected trainer (if any)
- `connectionStatus`: TrainerConnectionStatus enum
- `relationshipId`: ID of the trainer-student relationship
- `assignedWorkouts`: Array of trainer-created workouts
- `searchResults`: Results from trainer search
- `isFeatureEnabled`: Feature flag check

Key methods:
- `loadCurrentTrainer()`: Loads current trainer and relationship
- `searchTrainers()`: Search by name (500ms debounce)
- `findByInviteCode()`: Find trainer by invite code
- `requestConnection(to:)`: Send connection request
- `cancelConnection()`: Cancel active connection
- `startObservingRelationship()`: Real-time relationship updates
- `startObservingWorkouts()`: Real-time assigned workouts

### **TrainerSearchView**
Modal search interface:
- Search header with TextField and clear button
- Invite code section with dedicated input
- Search results showing TrainerCard components
- Debounced search (500ms delay)
- Loading, no results, and prompt states

### **TrainerCard Component**
Two variants:
- **Compact**: Photo (56x56), name, 2 specializations, chevron
- **Expanded**: Photo (80x80), name, email, bio, all specializations as tags

Features:
- Placeholder with first initial if no photo
- Active check badge
- FlowLayout for wrapping specializations
- Tappable to select trainer

---

## 3. TRAINER MANAGEMENT REPOSITORIES & SERVICES

### **PersonalTrainerRepository Protocol**
```swift
protocol PersonalTrainerRepository: Sendable {
    func fetchTrainer(id: String) async throws -> PersonalTrainer
    func searchTrainers(query: String, limit: Int) async throws -> [PersonalTrainer]
    func findByInviteCode(_ code: String) async throws -> PersonalTrainer?
}
```

### **TrainerStudentRepository Protocol**
```swift
protocol TrainerStudentRepository: Sendable {
    func requestConnection(trainerId: String, studentId: String, studentDisplayName: String) async throws -> String
    func cancelConnection(relationshipId: String) async throws
    func getCurrentRelationship(studentId: String) async throws -> TrainerStudentRelationship?
    func observeRelationship(studentId: String) -> AsyncStream<TrainerStudentRelationship?>
}
```

### **FirebasePersonalTrainerService**
Actor-based service with collections:
- **Collection**: `personalTrainers`
- **Collection**: `trainerStudents`

Methods:
- `fetchTrainer(id:)`: Gets single trainer by ID
- `searchTrainers(query:, limit:)`: Case-insensitive prefix search on `displayName` field
- `findByInviteCode(_:)`: Case-insensitive search on `inviteCode` field (active trainers only)
- `requestConnection(...)`: Creates new `trainerStudents` doc with:
  - Status: "pending"
  - RequestedBy: "student"
  - Subscription: "trial" (default)
  - Validation: Checks trainer is active and under student cap
- `cancelConnection(relationshipId:)`: Sets status to "cancelled"
- `observeRelationship(studentId:)`: Real-time listener for active/pending/paused relationships
- `getCurrentRelationship(studentId:)`: Single fetch of current relationship

### **FirebasePersonalTrainerRepository**
Implements both `PersonalTrainerRepository` and `TrainerStudentRepository`:
- Uses `PersonalTrainerMapper` for DTO‚ÜíDomain conversions
- Maps error codes (404, 400, 409) to appropriate `DomainError` types

### **Domain Models** (PersonalTrainerModels.swift)

**PersonalTrainer**:
```swift
struct PersonalTrainer: Sendable, Identifiable, Hashable, Codable {
    let id: String
    var displayName: String
    var email: String
    var photoURL: URL?
    var specializations: [String]
    var bio: String?
    var isActive: Bool
    var inviteCode: String?
    var maxStudents: Int
    var currentStudentCount: Int
    var canAcceptStudents: Bool // Computed
}
```

**TrainerStudentRelationship**:
```swift
struct TrainerStudentRelationship: Sendable, Identifiable, Hashable, Codable {
    let id: String
    let trainerId: String
    let studentId: String
    var status: TrainerConnectionStatus // enum: pending, active, paused, cancelled
    let requestedBy: RequestedBy // enum: student, trainer
    let requestedAt: Date
    var acceptedAt: Date?
    var subscriptionStatus: TrainerSubscriptionStatus // enum: trial, active, expired
    var subscriptionExpiresAt: Date?
    var isValid: Bool // Computed: status == .active && (sub == .active || .trial)
}
```

### **Firebase DTOs**

**FBPersonalTrainer** (Collection: `personalTrainers/{id}`):
- id (DocumentID)
- displayName, email, photoURL
- specializations: [String]
- bio, isActive, inviteCode
- maxStudents, currentStudentCount
- createdAt, updatedAt (ServerTimestamp)

**FBTrainerStudent** (Collection: `trainerStudents/{id}`):
- id (DocumentID)
- trainerId, studentId
- status: String (pending|active|paused|cancelled)
- requestedBy: String (student|trainer)
- requestedAt (ServerTimestamp)
- acceptedAt: Timestamp?
- subscriptionStatus: String (trial|active|expired)
- subscriptionExpiresAt: Timestamp?
- createdAt (ServerTimestamp)

---

## 4. TRAINER-ASSIGNED WORKOUTS

### **TrainerWorkoutRepository Protocol**
```swift
protocol TrainerWorkoutRepository: Sendable {
    func fetchAssignedWorkouts(studentId: String) async throws -> [TrainerWorkout]
    func observeAssignedWorkouts(studentId: String) -> AsyncStream<[TrainerWorkout]>
}
```

### **FirebaseTrainerWorkoutService**
**Collection**: `trainerWorkouts`

Methods:
- `fetchAssignedWorkouts(studentId:)`: Query where `assignedStudents` array contains studentId AND `isActive` == true, ordered by `createdAt` descending
- `observeAssignedWorkouts(studentId:)`: Real-time listener (snapshot)
- `fetchWorkout(id:)`: Get single workout by ID
- `fetchWorkoutsByTrainer(trainerId:, activeOnly:)`: Get all workouts created by trainer

### **FirebaseTrainerWorkoutRepository**
Implements `TrainerWorkoutRepository`:
- Maps `FBTrainerWorkout` to `TrainerWorkout` domain models
- Uses `TrainerWorkoutMapper` for conversions
- Wraps AsyncStream properly

### **FBTrainerWorkout DTO** (Collection: `trainerWorkouts/{id}`)
```swift
struct FBTrainerWorkout: Codable {
    @DocumentID var id: String?
    var trainerId: String
    var assignedStudents: [String]
    var title: String
    var description: String?
    var focus: String // Maps to DailyFocus
    var estimatedDurationMinutes: Int
    var intensity: String // "low", "moderate", "high"
    var phases: [FBWorkoutPhase]
    var schedule: FBWorkoutSchedule
    var isActive: Bool
    @ServerTimestamp var createdAt: Timestamp?
    var version: Int
}
```

With nested:
- **FBWorkoutPhase**: name, items: [FBWorkoutItem]
- **FBWorkoutItem**: exerciseId, exerciseName, sets, reps (string), restSeconds, notes
- **FBWorkoutSchedule**: type (once|recurring|weekly), scheduledDate, dayOfWeek

### **TrainerWorkout Domain Model**
Maps to full structure with:
- TrainerWorkoutPhase containing TrainerWorkoutItem
- TrainerWorkoutSchedule with enum-based type
- IntRange for reps (lower/upper bounds)

### **TrainerWorkoutMapper**
Handles conversions:
- **toDomain**: FBTrainerWorkout ‚Üí TrainerWorkout
- **toWorkoutPlan**: TrainerWorkout ‚Üí WorkoutPlan (for execution)
- Maps focus strings to `DailyFocus` enum
- Maps intensity strings to `WorkoutIntensity` enum
- Parses rep ranges (e.g., "8-12" ‚Üí IntRange(8, 12))
- Infers workout phase kind from phase name (warmup, strength, accessory, conditioning, aerobic, finisher, cooldown)
- Creates WorkoutExercise with default fullBody muscle group

---

## 5. USE CASES & ERROR HANDLING

### **PersonalTrainerUseCases.swift**

**PersonalTrainerError** enum:
- featureDisabled
- trainerNotFound
- invalidInviteCode
- alreadyConnected
- connectionNotFound
- unauthorized
- networkError(underlying: Error)

**Protocols & Implementations**:

1. **DiscoverTrainersUseCaseProtocol**
   - `searchByName(_:limit:)` ‚Üí [PersonalTrainer]
   - `findByInviteCode(_:)` ‚Üí PersonalTrainer?
   - Checks feature flag: `.personalTrainerEnabled`

2. **RequestTrainerConnectionUseCaseProtocol**
   - `execute(trainerId:)` ‚Üí String (relationshipId)
   - Checks feature flag
   - Validates current user
   - Prevents duplicate active/pending connections

3. **CancelTrainerConnectionUseCaseProtocol**
   - `execute(relationshipId:)` ‚Üí Void
   - Checks feature flag
   - Validates authorization

4. **GetCurrentTrainerUseCaseProtocol**
   - `execute()` ‚Üí (trainer: PersonalTrainer, relationship: TrainerStudentRelationship)?
   - `observeRelationship()` ‚Üí AsyncStream<TrainerStudentRelationship?>
   - Returns nil if feature disabled, no user, no relationship, or status not active/pending

5. **FetchAssignedWorkoutsUseCaseProtocol**
   - `execute()` ‚Üí [TrainerWorkout]
   - `observe()` ‚Üí AsyncStream<[TrainerWorkout]>
   - Checks feature flag: `.cmsWorkoutSyncEnabled`
   - Returns empty if no user

---

## 6. MAPPERS

### **PersonalTrainerMapper**
- `toDomain(_:id:)`: FBPersonalTrainer ‚Üí PersonalTrainer
- `toRelationship(_:id:)`: FBTrainerStudent ‚Üí TrainerStudentRelationship
  - Handles enum conversions with fallbacks
  - Converts Firestore Timestamps to Date

### **TrainerWorkoutMapper**
- Complex multi-step conversion with helpers for:
  - Focus string ‚Üí DailyFocus enum
  - Intensity string ‚Üí WorkoutIntensity enum
  - Phase name ‚Üí WorkoutPlanPhase.Kind (inferred)
  - Rep string (e.g., "8-12") ‚Üí IntRange
  - Schedule type string ‚Üí TrainerWorkoutScheduleType enum
  - Full TrainerWorkout ‚Üí WorkoutPlan (for execution)

---

## 7. KEY FIREBASE COLLECTIONS STRUCTURE

```
/personalTrainers/{trainerId}
  - displayName, email, photoURL
  - specializations: [String]
  - bio, isActive, inviteCode
  - maxStudents, currentStudentCount
  - createdAt, updatedAt

/trainerStudents/{relationshipId}
  - trainerId, studentId
  - status: "pending" | "active" | "paused" | "cancelled"
  - requestedBy: "student" | "trainer"
  - requestedAt, acceptedAt
  - subscriptionStatus: "trial" | "active" | "expired"
  - subscriptionExpiresAt
  - createdAt

/personalWorkouts/{workoutId}
  - trainerId, userId
  - title, description
  - fileURL, fileType: "pdf" | "image"
  - createdAt, viewedAt

/trainerWorkouts/{workoutId}
  - trainerId
  - assignedStudents: [String]
  - title, description
  - focus, intensity
  - estimatedDurationMinutes
  - phases: [{name, items: [{...}]}]
  - schedule: {type, scheduledDate, dayOfWeek}
  - isActive
  - createdAt, version
```

---

## 8. CURRENT STATE SUMMARY

The Personal Trainer integration includes **two parallel features**:

1. **Personal Trainer PDF Workouts**: Simple file-based workouts sent by trainers (viewed via PDFViewerView)
2. **Trainer Connection & Assignment**: Full relationship management with trainer-created structured workouts that can be executed

**Feature Flags**:
- `.personalTrainerEnabled`: Controls trainer connection, search, discovery
- `.cmsWorkoutSyncEnabled`: Controls trainer-assigned workouts

**Missing/To Implement**:
- TrainerStudentRepository Firebase implementation (only service layer exists)
- PDF Viewer implementation (referenced but not included)
- Firebase mapper implementations
- Dependency injection setup
- ConnectionRequestSheet component
- Any UI for managing subscription status or accepting trainer invites

The architecture is clean, well-layered, and follows the MVVM pattern with proper use of protocols, DTOs, and domain models.

- Relative date with clock icon
- "Offline" indicator with checkmark if cached
- Border highlights blue for new workouts

---

## 2. TRAINER CONNECTION & DISCOVERY

### **PersonalTrainerView**
Main trainer connection interface with:
- Loading state
- Feature disabled view ("Em breve")
- Find trainer section with:
  - Search button to open sheet
  - Invite code input with uppercase formatting
  - Benefits list (4 items)
- Connected trainer section showing:
  - Trainer card (expanded variant)
  - Connection status badge (colors based on active/pending/paused/cancelled)
  - Assigned workouts list (if connected)
  - Disconnect/Cancel buttons

### **PersonalTrainerViewModel**
Manages trainer connection flow:
- `currentTrainer`: The connected trainer (if any)
- `connectionStatus`: TrainerConnectionStatus enum
- `relationshipId`: ID of the trainer-student relationship
- `assignedWorkouts`: Array of trainer-created workouts
- `searchResults`: Results from trainer search
- `isFeatureEnabled`: Feature flag check

Key methods:
- `loadCurrentTrainer()`: Loads current trainer and relationship
- `searchTrainers()`: Search by name (500ms debounce)
- `findByInviteCode()`: Find trainer by invite code
- `requestConnection(to:)`: Send connection request
- `cancelConnection()`: Cancel active connection
- `startObservingRelationship()`: Real-time relationship updates
- `startObservingWorkouts()`: Real-time assigned workouts

### **TrainerSearchView**
Modal search interface:
- Search header with TextField and clear button
- Invite code section with dedicated input
- Search results showing TrainerCard components
- Debounced search (500ms delay)
- Loading, no results, and prompt states

### **TrainerCard Component**
Two variants:
- **Compact**: Photo (56x56), name, 2 specializations, chevron
- **Expanded**: Photo (80x80), name, email, bio, all specializations as tags

Features:
- Placeholder with first initial if no photo
- Active check badge
- FlowLayout for wrapping specializations
- Tappable to select trainer

---

## 3. TRAINER MANAGEMENT REPOSITORIES & SERVICES

### **PersonalTrainerRepository Protocol**
```swift
protocol PersonalTrainerRepository: Sendable {
    func fetchTrainer(id: String) async throws -> PersonalTrainer
    func searchTrainers(query: String, limit: Int) async throws -> [PersonalTrainer]
    func findByInviteCode(_ code: String) async throws -> PersonalTrainer?
}
```

### **TrainerStudentRepository Protocol**
```swift
protocol TrainerStudentRepository: Sendable {
    func requestConnection(trainerId: String, studentId: String, studentDisplayName: String) async throws -> String
    func cancelConnection(relationshipId: String) async throws
    func getCurrentRelationship(studentId: String) async throws -> TrainerStudentRelationship?
    func observeRelationship(studentId: String) -> AsyncStream<TrainerStudentRelationship?>
}
```

### **FirebasePersonalTrainerService**
Actor-based service with collections:
- **Collection**: `personalTrainers`
- **Collection**: `trainerStudents`

Methods:
- `fetchTrainer(id:)`: Gets single trainer by ID
- `searchTrainers(query:, limit:)`: Case-insensitive prefix search on `displayName` field
- `findByInviteCode(_:)`: Case-insensitive search on `inviteCode` field (active trainers only)
- `requestConnection(...)`: Creates new `trainerStudents` doc with:
  - Status: "pending"
  - RequestedBy: "student"
  - Subscription: "trial" (default)
  - Validation: Checks trainer is active and under student cap
- `cancelConnection(relationshipId:)`: Sets status to "cancelled"
- `observeRelationship(studentId:)`: Real-time listener for active/pending/paused relationships
- `getCurrentRelationship(studentId:)`: Single fetch of current relationship

### **FirebasePersonalTrainerRepository**
Implements both `PersonalTrainerRepository` and `TrainerStudentRepository`:
- Uses `PersonalTrainerMapper` for DTO‚ÜíDomain conversions
- Maps error codes (404, 400, 409) to appropriate `DomainError` types

### **Domain Models** (PersonalTrainerModels.swift)

**PersonalTrainer**:
```swift
struct PersonalTrainer: Sendable, Identifiable, Hashable, Codable {
    let id: String
    var displayName: String
    var email: String
    var photoURL: URL?
    var specializations: [String]
    var bio: String?
    var isActive: Bool
    var inviteCode: String?
    var maxStudents: Int
    var currentStudentCount: Int
    var canAcceptStudents: Bool // Computed
}
```

**TrainerStudentRelationship**:
```swift
struct TrainerStudentRelationship: Sendable, Identifiable, Hashable, Codable {
    let id: String
    let trainerId: String
    let studentId: String
    var status: TrainerConnectionStatus // enum: pending, active, paused, cancelled
    let requestedBy: RequestedBy // enum: student, trainer
    let requestedAt: Date
    var acceptedAt: Date?
    var subscriptionStatus: TrainerSubscriptionStatus // enum: trial, active, expired
    var subscriptionExpiresAt: Date?
    var isValid: Bool // Computed: status == .active && (sub == .active || .trial)
}
```

### **Firebase DTOs**

**FBPersonalTrainer** (Collection: `personalTrainers/{id}`):
- id (DocumentID)
- displayName, email, photoURL
- specializations: [String]
- bio, isActive, inviteCode
- maxStudents, currentStudentCount
- createdAt, updatedAt (ServerTimestamp)

**FBTrainerStudent** (Collection: `trainerStudents/{id}`):
- id (DocumentID)
- trainerId, studentId
- status: String (pending|active|paused|cancelled)
- requestedBy: String (student|trainer)
- requestedAt (ServerTimestamp)
- acceptedAt: Timestamp?
- subscriptionStatus: String (trial|active|expired)
- subscriptionExpiresAt: Timestamp?
- createdAt (ServerTimestamp)

---

## 4. TRAINER-ASSIGNED WORKOUTS

### **TrainerWorkoutRepository Protocol**
```swift
protocol TrainerWorkoutRepository: Sendable {
    func fetchAssignedWorkouts(studentId: String) async throws -> [TrainerWorkout]
    func observeAssignedWorkouts(studentId: String) -> AsyncStream<[TrainerWorkout]>
}
```

### **FirebaseTrainerWorkoutService**
**Collection**: `trainerWorkouts`

Methods:
- `fetchAssignedWorkouts(studentId:)`: Query where `assignedStudents` array contains studentId AND `isActive` == true, ordered by `createdAt` descending
- `observeAssignedWorkouts(studentId:)`: Real-time listener (snapshot)
- `fetchWorkout(id:)`: Get single workout by ID
- `fetchWorkoutsByTrainer(trainerId:, activeOnly:)`: Get all workouts created by trainer

### **FirebaseTrainerWorkoutRepository**
Implements `TrainerWorkoutRepository`:
- Maps `FBTrainerWorkout` to `TrainerWorkout` domain models
- Uses `TrainerWorkoutMapper` for conversions
- Wraps AsyncStream properly

### **FBTrainerWorkout DTO** (Collection: `trainerWorkouts/{id}`)
```swift
struct FBTrainerWorkout: Codable {
    @DocumentID var id: String?
    var trainerId: String
    var assignedStudents: [String]
    var title: String
    var description: String?
    var focus: String // Maps to DailyFocus
    var estimatedDurationMinutes: Int
    var intensity: String // "low", "moderate", "high"
    var phases: [FBWorkoutPhase]
    var schedule: FBWorkoutSchedule
    var isActive: Bool
    @ServerTimestamp var createdAt: Timestamp?
    var version: Int
}
```

With nested:
- **FBWorkoutPhase**: name, items: [FBWorkoutItem]
- **FBWorkoutItem**: exerciseId, exerciseName, sets, reps (string), restSeconds, notes
- **FBWorkoutSchedule**: type (once|recurring|weekly), scheduledDate, dayOfWeek

### **TrainerWorkout Domain Model**
Maps to full structure with:
- TrainerWorkoutPhase containing TrainerWorkoutItem
- TrainerWorkoutSchedule with enum-based type
- IntRange for reps (lower/upper bounds)

### **TrainerWorkoutMapper**
Handles conversions:
- **toDomain**: FBTrainerWorkout ‚Üí TrainerWorkout
- **toWorkoutPlan**: TrainerWorkout ‚Üí WorkoutPlan (for execution)
- Maps focus strings to `DailyFocus` enum
- Maps intensity strings to `WorkoutIntensity` enum
- Parses rep ranges (e.g., "8-12" ‚Üí IntRange(8, 12))
- Infers workout phase kind from phase name (warmup, strength, accessory, conditioning, aerobic, finisher, cooldown)
- Creates WorkoutExercise with default fullBody muscle group

---

## 5. USE CASES & ERROR HANDLING

### **PersonalTrainerUseCases.swift**

**PersonalTrainerError** enum:
- featureDisabled
- trainerNotFound
- invalidInviteCode
- alreadyConnected
- connectionNotFound
- unauthorized
- networkError(underlying: Error)

**Protocols & Implementations**:

1. **DiscoverTrainersUseCaseProtocol**
   - `searchByName(_:limit:)` ‚Üí [PersonalTrainer]
   - `findByInviteCode(_:)` ‚Üí PersonalTrainer?
   - Checks feature flag: `.personalTrainerEnabled`

2. **RequestTrainerConnectionUseCaseProtocol**
   - `execute(trainerId:)` ‚Üí String (relationshipId)
   - Checks feature flag
   - Validates current user
   - Prevents duplicate active/pending connections

3. **CancelTrainerConnectionUseCaseProtocol**
   - `execute(relationshipId:)` ‚Üí Void
   - Checks feature flag
   - Validates authorization

4. **GetCurrentTrainerUseCaseProtocol**
   - `execute()` ‚Üí (trainer: PersonalTrainer, relationship: TrainerStudentRelationship)?
   - `observeRelationship()` ‚Üí AsyncStream<TrainerStudentRelationship?>
   - Returns nil if feature disabled, no user, no relationship, or status not active/pending

5. **FetchAssignedWorkoutsUseCaseProtocol**
   - `execute()` ‚Üí [TrainerWorkout]
   - `observe()` ‚Üí AsyncStream<[TrainerWorkout]>
   - Checks feature flag: `.cmsWorkoutSyncEnabled`
   - Returns empty if no user

---

## 6. MAPPERS

### **PersonalTrainerMapper**
- `toDomain(_:id:)`: FBPersonalTrainer ‚Üí PersonalTrainer
- `toRelationship(_:id:)`: FBTrainerStudent ‚Üí TrainerStudentRelationship
  - Handles enum conversions with fallbacks
  - Converts Firestore Timestamps to Date

### **TrainerWorkoutMapper**
- Complex multi-step conversion with helpers for:
  - Focus string ‚Üí DailyFocus enum
  - Intensity string ‚Üí WorkoutIntensity enum
  - Phase name ‚Üí WorkoutPlanPhase.Kind (inferred)
  - Rep string (e.g., "8-12") ‚Üí IntRange
  - Schedule type string ‚Üí TrainerWorkoutScheduleType enum
  - Full TrainerWorkout ‚Üí WorkoutPlan (for execution)

---

## 7. KEY FIREBASE COLLECTIONS STRUCTURE

```
/personalTrainers/{trainerId}
  - displayName, email, photoURL
  - specializations: [String]
  - bio, isActive, inviteCode
  - maxStudents, currentStudentCount
  - createdAt, updatedAt

/trainerStudents/{relationshipId}
  - trainerId, studentId
  - status: "pending" | "active" | "paused" | "cancelled"
  - requestedBy: "student" | "trainer"
  - requestedAt, acceptedAt
  - subscriptionStatus: "trial" | "active" | "expired"
  - subscriptionExpiresAt
  - createdAt

/personalWorkouts/{workoutId}
  - trainerId, userId
  - title, description
  - fileURL, fileType: "pdf" | "image"
  - createdAt, viewedAt

/trainerWorkouts/{workoutId}
  - trainerId
  - assignedStudents: [String]
  - title, description
  - focus, intensity
  - estimatedDurationMinutes
  - phases: [{name, items: [{...}]}]
  - schedule: {type, scheduledDate, dayOfWeek}
  - isActive
  - createdAt, version
```

---

## 8. CURRENT STATE SUMMARY

The Personal Trainer integration includes **two parallel features**:

1. **Personal Trainer PDF Workouts**: Simple file-based workouts sent by trainers (viewed via PDFViewerView)
2. **Trainer Connection & Assignment**: Full relationship management with trainer-created structured workouts that can be executed

**Feature Flags**:
- `.personalTrainerEnabled`: Controls trainer connection, search, discovery
- `.cmsWorkoutSyncEnabled`: Controls trainer-assigned workouts

**Missing/To Implement**:
- TrainerStudentRepository Firebase implementation (only service layer exists)
- PDF Viewer implementation (referenced but not included)
- Firebase mapper implementations
- Dependency injection setup
- ConnectionRequestSheet component
- Any UI for managing subscription status or accepting trainer invites

The architecture is clean, well-layered, and follows the MVVM pattern with proper use of protocols, DTOs, and domain models.

   180‚Üí    private func buildRequest(url: URL, method: String) throws -> URLRequest {
   181‚Üí        var request = URLRequest(url: url)
   182‚Üí        request.httpMethod = method
   183‚Üí        request.setValue("application/json", forHTTPHeaderField: "Content-Type")
   184‚Üí        request.setValue("application/json", forHTTPHeaderField: "Accept")
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí        if let apiKey = configuration.apiKey {
   187‚Üí            request.setValue("Bearer \(apiKey)", forHTTPHeaderField: "Authorization")
   188‚Üí        }
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí        return request
   191‚Üí    }
   192‚Üí
   193‚Üí    private func execute<T: Decodable>(request: URLRequest) async throws -> T {
   194‚Üí        #if DEBUG
   195‚Üí        print("[CMSWorkoutService] \(request.httpMethod ?? "GET") \(request.url?.absoluteString ?? "")")
   196‚Üí        #endif
   197‚Üí
   198‚Üí        let (data, response) = try await session.data(for: request)
   199‚Üí
   200‚Üí        guard let httpResponse = response as? HTTPURLResponse else {
   201‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.invalidResponse
   202‚Üí        }
   203‚Üí
   204‚Üí        #if DEBUG
   205‚Üí        print("[CMSWorkoutService] Status: \(httpResponse.statusCode)")
   206‚Üí        #endif
   207‚Üí
   208‚Üí        switch httpResponse.statusCode {
   209‚Üí        case 200...299:
   210‚Üí            do {
   211‚Üí                return try decoder.decode(T.self, from: data)
   212‚Üí            } catch {
   213‚Üí                #if DEBUG
   214‚Üí                print("[CMSWorkoutService] Decode error: \(error)")
   215‚Üí                if let json = String(data: data, encoding: .utf8) {
   216‚Üí                    print("[CMSWorkoutService] Response: \(json.prefix(500))")
   217‚Üí                }
   218‚Üí                #endif
   219‚Üí                throw CMSServiceError.decodingFailed(error)
   220‚Üí            }
   221‚Üí
   222‚Üí        case 401:
   223‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.unauthorized
   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí        case 403:
   226‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.forbidden
   227‚Üí
   228‚Üí        case 404:
   229‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.notFound
   230‚Üí
   231‚Üí        case 429:
   232‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.rateLimited
   233‚Üí
   234‚Üí        case 500...599:
   235‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.serverError(httpResponse.statusCode)
   236‚Üí
   237‚Üí        default:
   238‚Üí            if let apiError = try? decoder.decode(CMSAPIError.self, from: data) {
   239‚Üí                throw CMSServiceError.apiError(apiError)
   240‚Üí            }
   241‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.unexpectedStatus(httpResponse.statusCode)
   242‚Üí        }
   243‚Üí    }
   244‚Üí}

   253‚Üí/// Errors that can occur during CMS API operations.
   254‚Üíenum CMSServiceError: LocalizedError, Sendable {
   255‚Üí    case invalidURL

   258‚Üí    case forbidden
   259‚Üí    case notFound
   260‚Üí    case rateLimited
   261‚Üí    case serverError(Int)
   262‚Üí    case unexpectedStatus(Int)
   263‚Üí    case decodingFailed(Error)
   264‚Üí    case apiError(CMSAPIError)
   265‚Üí    case networkError(Error)
   266‚Üí
   267‚Üí    var errorDescription: String? {
   268‚Üí        switch self {
   269‚Üí        case .invalidURL:
   270‚Üí            return "URL invalida"
   271‚Üí        case .invalidResponse:
   272‚Üí            return "Resposta invalida do servidor"
   273‚Üí        case .unauthorized:
   274‚Üí            return "Sessao expirada. Faca login novamente."
   275‚Üí        case .forbidden:
   276‚Üí            return "Voce nao tem permissao para acessar este recurso"
   277‚Üí        case .notFound:
   278‚Üí            return "Treino nao encontrado"
   279‚Üí        case .rateLimited:
   280‚Üí            return "Muitas requisicoes. Aguarde um momento."
   281‚Üí        case .serverError(let code):
   282‚Üí            return "Erro no servidor (\(code)). Tente novamente."
   283‚Üí        case .unexpectedStatus(let code):
   284‚Üí            return "Erro inesperado (\(code))"
   285‚Üí        case .decodingFailed:
   286‚Üí            return "Erro ao processar resposta"
   287‚Üí        case .apiError(let error):
   288‚Üí            return error.message
   289‚Üí        case .networkError:
   290‚Üí            return "Erro de conexao. Verifique sua internet."
   291‚Üí        }
   292‚Üí    }
   293‚Üí}

input.prompt:
## Context

The FitToday iOS app needs to complete the integration between the mobile app and a CMS web API (`https://web-cms-pink.vercel.app`) that personal trainers use to manage student workouts. The backend/data layer is already fully implemented but NOT connected to the UI.

## Current State

### What EXISTS (fully implemented):
1. **CMSWorkoutService** (`Data/Services/CMS/CMSWorkoutService.swift`) - Actor-based REST client with ALL endpoints implemented. BUT the base URL is `https://api.fittoday.app` - needs to be changed to `https://web-cms-pink.vercel.app`
2. **CMSWorkoutModels** (`Data/Models/CMSWorkoutModels.swift`) - All DTOs: CMSWorkout, CMSWorkoutPhase, CMSWorkoutItem, CMSWorkoutProgress, CMSWorkoutFeedback, CMSWorkoutStatus etc.
3. **CMSWorkoutRepository protocol + impl** (`Domain/Protocols/CMSWorkoutRepository.swift`, `Data/Repositories/CMSWorkoutRepositoryImpl.swift`)
4. **7 Use Cases** (`Domain/UseCases/CMSWorkoutUseCases.swift`): FetchCMSWorkoutsUseCase, FetchCMSWorkoutDetailUseCase, FetchWorkoutProgressUseCase, FetchWorkoutFeedbackUseCase, PostWorkoutFeedbackUseCase, CompleteCMSWorkoutUseCase, ArchiveCMSWorkoutUseCase
5. **CMSWorkoutMapper** (`Data/Mappers/CMSWorkoutMapper.swift`) - Maps CMSWorkout‚ÜíTrainerWorkout and CMSWorkout‚ÜíWorkoutPlan
6. **DI Registration** in AppContainer.swift - All CMS use cases registered
7. **PersonalTrainerView** + **PersonalTrainerViewModel** - Shows trainer connection, search, invite code, connection status, and lists `TrainerWorkout` items from Firebase
8. **PersonalWorkoutsListView** - Shows PDF-based workouts sent by trainer via Firebase

### What's MISSING:
1. **Base URL needs updating** from `https://api.fittoday.app` to `https://web-cms-pink.vercel.app`
2. **CMS workouts are not shown in the UI** - The `PersonalTrainerView` shows `TrainerWorkout` from Firebase but does NOT consume the CMS API
3. **No workout detail view** for CMS workouts (to see exercises, phases, progress)
4. **No feedback view** - The student cannot send feedback to the trainer on a specific workout
5. **The CMS API uses `?studentId=` parameter** (camelCase) but the service uses `student_id` (snake_case) - may need to verify

### API Endpoints (from web-cms-pink.vercel.app):
- GET /api/workouts?studentId= - List workouts
- POST /api/workouts - Create (trainer-side only)
- GET /api/workouts/[id] - Get workout by ID
- PATCH /api/workouts/[id] - Update workout
- DELETE /api/workouts/[id] - Delete workout
- GET /api/workouts/[id]/progress - Get progress
- GET /api/workouts/[id]/feedback - Get feedback
- POST /api/workouts/[id]/feedback - Send feedback

### Architecture Rules:
- MVVM with @Observable, @MainActor
- Swinject DI
- Domain layer: Use cases, protocols
- Data layer: Repositories, services, mappers
- Presentation: Features folders with Views/ViewModels
- SwiftUI, iOS 17+, Swift 6

### Key Constraint:
- Each student connects with ONLY ONE personal trainer
- All trainer details management happens in web-cms-pink (not in the app)
- Keep changes minimal and simple

## Design Task

Design a plan to:
1. Fix the base URL in CMSWorkoutService
2. Fix the query parameter name (studentId vs student_id) if needed
3. Wire the CMS workouts to the `PersonalTrainerView` UI (replacing or complementing the Firebase `TrainerWorkout` items)
4. Create a CMS workout detail view showing exercises, phases, progress
5. Create a feedback mechanism (send feedback on a workout)
6. Add necessary navigation routes in AppRouter

Keep it simple. Reuse existing components (ExerciseRowCard patterns, FitCard, FitTodayFont/Color/Spacing). Prefer editing existing files over creating many new ones. The student flow should be: See trainer ‚Üí See assigned workouts ‚Üí Tap workout ‚Üí See detail with exercises ‚Üí Give feedback.

message.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The summary below covers the earlier portion of the conversation.

Analysis:
Let me chronologically analyze the conversation:

1. **First request**: User reported bugs in the workout program exercise ordering, add exercise button not working, and save workout not functioning. They asked to use `/feature-marker --interactive`.

2. **Feature marker workflow**: I launched the feature-marker skill in interactive mode, the user selected to execute tasks and create unit tests.

3. **Exploration phase**: I used an Explore agent to thoroughly map the codebase structure - found all workout/program related files across Domain, Data, and Presentation layers.

4. **Bug identification**: After reading key files, I identified 3 critical bugs:
   - `CreateWorkoutViewModel.saveWorkout()` had a `TODO` placeholder - never persisted to repository
   - `ProgramWorkoutDetailView` had `showAddExercise` state but no `.sheet()` modifier
   - Exercise ordering used `LazyVStack` with `.onMove` which doesn't work (only `List` supports `.onMove`)

5. **Fix 1 - Save workout**: 
   - Added `saveUseCase: SaveCustomWorkoutUseCase?` to `CreateWorkoutViewModel`
   - Updated `saveWorkout()` to call `saveUseCase.execute(template:)` 
   - Updated `CreateWorkoutView` init to resolve `SaveCustomWorkoutUseCase` from DI container

6. **Fix 2 - Add exercise button**:
   - Added `.sheet(isPresented: $showAddExercise)` with `ExerciseSearchSheet`
   - Created `addExerciseEntry(_:)` method to convert `CustomExerciseEntry` ‚Üí `ProgramExercise`

7. **Fix 3 - Exercise ordering**:
   - Replaced `LazyVStack` + `.onMove/.onDelete` with `VStack` + up/down arrow buttons
   - Updated `ExerciseRowCard` to accept `onMoveUp`, `onMoveDown`, `onDelete` callbacks

8. **Tests**: Created `SaveCustomWorkoutUseCaseTests.swift` with `MockCustomWorkoutRepository` and tests for SaveCustomWorkoutUseCase, CreateWorkoutViewModel, and EditWorkoutViewModel.

9. **Second request**: User asked to add `.entire/` to `.gitignore` and commit+push. Done successfully.

10. **Third request**: User reported title disappearing when switching segments in the Workout tab.

11. **Title fix**: 
    - Root cause: conflicting `.navigationTitle` between `WorkoutTabView` (.large) and `ProgramsListView` (.inline)
    - Fix: Replaced system `navigationTitle` with a fixed `Text` header in the `VStack`, hidden the navigation bar, removed conflicting modifiers from `ProgramsListView`

12. **Fourth request (current)**: User wants to complete the CMS API integration for personal trainer workouts. They provided the API endpoints from `https://web-cms-pink.vercel.app`. Key points:
    - One student ‚Üî one personal trainer relationship
    - Student management happens in web-cms
    - Need full integration for viewing trainer-sent workouts

13. **Plan mode activated**: I explored the codebase thoroughly with 3 parallel agents, then created a detailed plan. The plan covers:

     private let saveUseCase: SaveCustomWorkoutUseCase?

     func saveWorkout() async {

    11‚Üíenum AppTab: Hashable, CaseIterable {
    12‚Üí    case home
    13‚Üí    case workout
    14‚Üí    case create
    15‚Üí    case activity
    16‚Üí    case profile
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí    var title: String {
    19‚Üí        switch self {
    20‚Üí        case .home: return "tab.home".localized
    21‚Üí        case .workout: return "tab.workout".localized
    22‚Üí        case .create: return "tab.create".localized
    23‚Üí        case .activity: return "tab.activity".localized
    24‚Üí        case .profile: return "tab.profile".localized
    25‚Üí        }
    26‚Üí    }
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üí    var systemImage: String {
    29‚Üí        switch self {
    30‚Üí        case .home: return "house.fill"
    31‚Üí        case .workout: return "dumbbell.fill"
    32‚Üí        case .create: return "plus.circle.fill"
    33‚Üí        case .activity: return "chart.bar.fill"
    34‚Üí        case .profile: return "person.fill"
    35‚Üí        }
    36‚Üí    }
    37‚Üí}

    39‚Üíenum AppRoute: Hashable {
    40‚Üí    case onboarding
    41‚Üí    case editProfile  // Rota separada para edi√ß√£o de perfil existente
    42‚Üí    case setup
    43‚Üí    case dailyQuestionnaire
    44‚Üí    case workoutPlan(UUID)
    45‚Üí    case exerciseDetail
    46‚Üí    case workoutExecution  // Nova view de execu√ß√£o com timer e pause/play
    47‚Üí    case workoutExercisePreview(ExercisePrescription)  // Preview de exerc√≠cio (n√£o altera √≠ndice)
    48‚Üí    case workoutPreview(ProgramWorkout)  // Preview de treino antes de iniciar (Task 7.0)
    49‚Üí    case workoutSummary
    50‚Üí    case paywall
    51‚Üí    case programDetail(String)  // Detalhe do programa
    52‚Üí    case programWorkoutDetail(ProgramWorkout)  // Detalhe de um treino dentro do programa (Wger exercises)
    53‚Üí    case libraryWorkoutDetail(String)  // Detalhe de um treino da biblioteca (por ID)
    54‚Üí    case programExerciseDetail(ExercisePrescription)  // Detalhe de exerc√≠cio na biblioteca/programa
    55‚Üí    case apiKeySettings  // Configura√ß√£o de chave de API do usu√°rio
    56‚Üí    case healthKitSettings // Integra√ß√£o Apple Health (PRO)
    57‚Üí    case privacySettings  // Privacy settings for social features
    58‚Üí    case authentication(inviteContext: String?)  // Authentication flow
    59‚Üí    case groupInvite(groupId: String)  // Group invitation deep link
    60‚Üí    case notifications  // Notifications screen for challenges
    61‚Üí    case customWorkouts  // Custom workout templates list
    62‚Üí    case customWorkoutBuilder(UUID?)  // Create or edit custom workout (nil = new)
    63‚Üí    case personalTrainer  // Personal Trainer connection and workouts
    64‚Üí    case trainerSearch  // Search for personal trainers
    65‚Üí}
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üístruct DeepLink {
    68‚Üí    enum Destination {
    69‚Üí        case home
    70‚Üí        case onboarding
    71‚Üí        case setup
    72‚Üí        case dailyQuestionnaire
    73‚Üí        case paywall
    74‚Üí        case groupInvite(groupId: String)
    75‚Üí    }
    76‚Üí
    77‚Üí    let destination: Destination
    78‚Üí
    79‚Üí    init?(url: URL) {
    80‚Üí        guard let scheme = url.scheme?.lowercased(), scheme == "fittoday" else {
    81‚Üí            return nil
    82‚Üí        }
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí        let host = url.host?.lowercased() ?? ""
    85‚Üí        let path = url.path.lowercased()
    86‚Üí
    87‚Üí        // Handle group invite: fittoday://group/invite/{groupId}
    88‚Üí        if host == "group", path.hasPrefix("/invite/") {
    89‚Üí            let groupId = String(path.dropFirst("/invite/".count))
    90‚Üí            destination = .groupInvite(groupId: groupId)
    91‚Üí            return
    92‚Üí        }
    93‚Üí
    94‚Üí        // Handle other routes
    95‚Üí        let pathOrHost = !host.isEmpty ? host : path
    96‚Üí        switch pathOrHost {
    97‚Üí        case "home", "/home":
    98‚Üí            destination = .home
    99‚Üí        case "onboarding", "/onboarding":
   100‚Üí            destination = .onboarding
   101‚Üí        case "setup", "/setup":
   102‚Üí            destination = .setup
   103‚Üí        case "daily", "/daily":
   104‚Üí            destination = .dailyQuestionnaire
   105‚Üí        case "paywall", "/paywall":
   106‚Üí            destination = .paywall
   107‚Üí        default:
   108‚Üí            return nil
   109‚Üí        }
   110‚Üí    }
   111‚Üí}
   112‚Üí
   113‚Üí@MainActor
   114‚Üíprotocol AppRouting: AnyObject {
   115‚Üí    var selectedTab: AppTab { get set }
   116‚Üí    var tabPaths: [AppTab: NavigationPath] { get set }
   117‚Üí
   118‚Üí    func select(tab: AppTab)
   119‚Üí    func push(_ route: AppRoute, on tab: AppTab?)
   120‚Üí    func pop(on tab: AppTab?)
   121‚Üí    func handle(deeplink: DeepLink)
   122‚Üí}
   123‚Üí
   124‚Üí// üí° Learn: Navega√ß√£o com @Observable permite melhor performance
   125‚Üí@MainActor
   126‚Üí@Observable final class AppRouter: AppRouting {
   127‚Üí    var selectedTab: AppTab = .home
   128‚Üí    var tabPaths: [AppTab: NavigationPath] = [:]
   129‚Üí
   130‚Üí    init() {
   131‚Üí        AppTab.allCases.forEach { tab in
   132‚Üí            tabPaths[tab] = NavigationPath()
   133‚Üí        }
   134‚Üí    }
   135‚Üí
   136‚Üí    func select(tab: AppTab) {
   137‚Üí        selectedTab = tab
   138‚Üí    }
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üí    func push(_ route: AppRoute, on tab: AppTab? = nil) {
   141‚Üí        let target = tab ?? selectedTab
   142‚Üí        if tabPaths[target] == nil {
   143‚Üí            tabPaths[target] = NavigationPath()
   144‚Üí        }
   145‚Üí        tabPaths[target]?.append(route)
   146‚Üí    }
   147‚Üí
   148‚Üí    func pop(on tab: AppTab? = nil) {
   149‚Üí        let target = tab ?? selectedTab
   150‚Üí        guard var path = tabPaths[target], !path.isEmpty else {
   151‚Üí            return
   152‚Üí        }
   153‚Üí        path.removeLast()
   154‚Üí        tabPaths[target] = path
   155‚Üí    }
   156‚Üí
   157‚Üí    func handle(deeplink: DeepLink) {
   158‚Üí        switch deeplink.destination {
   159‚Üí        case .home:
   160‚Üí            select(tab: .home)
   161‚Üí        case .onboarding:
   162‚Üí            select(tab: .home)
   163‚Üí            push(.onboarding, on: .home)
   164‚Üí        case .setup:
   165‚Üí            select(tab: .home)
   166‚Üí            push(.setup, on: .home)
   167‚Üí        case .dailyQuestionnaire:
   168‚Üí            select(tab: .home)
   169‚Üí            push(.dailyQuestionnaire, on: .home)
   170‚Üí        case .paywall:
   171‚Üí            select(tab: .home)
   172‚Üí            push(.paywall, on: .home)
   173‚Üí        case .groupInvite(let groupId):
   174‚Üí            select(tab: .home)
   175‚Üí            push(.groupInvite(groupId: groupId), on: .home)
   176‚Üí        }
   177‚Üí    }
   178‚Üí
   179‚Üí    func handle(url: URL) {
   180‚Üí        guard let link = DeepLink(url: url) else { return }
   181‚Üí        handle(deeplink: link)
   182‚Üí    }
   183‚Üí}
   184‚Üí

     5‚Üí//  Actor-based service for CMS Personal Trainer API integration.
     6‚Üí//  Handles all REST API interactions for trainer workouts.
     7‚Üí//
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üíimport Foundation
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí// MARK: - CMS Configuration
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí/// Configuration for CMS API connection.
    14‚Üístruct CMSConfiguration: Sendable {
    15‚Üí    let baseURL: URL
    16‚Üí    let apiKey: String?
    17‚Üí    let timeout: TimeInterval
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí    static let `default` = CMSConfiguration(
    20‚Üí        baseURL: URL(string: "https://api.fittoday.app")!,
    21‚Üí        apiKey: nil,
    22‚Üí        timeout: 30
    23‚Üí    )
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí    init(baseURL: URL, apiKey: String? = nil, timeout: TimeInterval = 30) {
    26‚Üí        self.baseURL = baseURL
    27‚Üí        self.apiKey = apiKey
    28‚Üí        self.timeout = timeout
    29‚Üí    }
    30‚Üí}
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí// MARK: - CMS Workout Service
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí/// Actor-based service for CMS workout API operations.
    35‚Üí///
    36‚Üí/// Provides type-safe access to all CMS workout endpoints:
    37‚Üí/// - GET/POST /api/workouts
    38‚Üí/// - GET/PATCH/DELETE /api/workouts/[id]
    39‚Üí/// - GET /api/workouts/[id]/progress
    40‚Üí/// - GET/POST /api/workouts/[id]/feedback
    41‚Üíactor CMSWorkoutService {
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí    // MARK: - Properties
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí    private let session: URLSession
    46‚Üí    private let configuration: CMSConfiguration
    47‚Üí    private let decoder: JSONDecoder
    48‚Üí    private let encoder: JSONEncoder
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí    // MARK: - Initialization
    51‚Üí
    52‚Üí    init(configuration: CMSConfiguration = .default) {
    53‚Üí        self.configuration = configuration
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üí        let sessionConfig = URLSessionConfiguration.default
    56‚Üí        sessionConfig.timeoutIntervalForRequest = configuration.timeout
    57‚Üí        sessionConfig.timeoutIntervalForResource = configuration.timeout * 2
    58‚Üí        self.session = URLSession(configuration: sessionConfig)
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí        self.decoder = JSONDecoder()
    61‚Üí        self.decoder.dateDecodingStrategy = .iso8601
    62‚Üí
    63‚Üí        self.encoder = JSONEncoder()
    64‚Üí        self.encoder.dateEncodingStrategy = .iso8601
    65‚Üí    }
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí    // MARK: - Workouts API
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí    /// Fetches workouts for a student from the CMS.
    70‚Üí    ///
    71‚Üí    /// - Parameters:
    72‚Üí    ///   - studentId: The student's user ID.
    73‚Üí    ///   - trainerId: Optional trainer ID to filter by.
    74‚Üí    ///   - page: Page number for pagination (default: 1).
    75‚Üí    ///   - limit: Number of items per page (default: 20).
    76‚Üí    /// - Returns: A paginated list of workouts.
    77‚Üí    /// - Throws: CMSServiceError if the request fails.
    78‚Üí    func fetchWorkouts(
    79‚Üí        studentId: String,
    80‚Üí        trainerId: String? = nil,
    81‚Üí        page: Int = 1,
    82‚Üí        limit: Int = 20
    83‚Üí    ) async throws -> CMSWorkoutListResponse {
    84‚Üí        var components = URLComponents(url: configuration.baseURL.appendingPathComponent("/api/workouts"), resolvingAgainstBaseURL: true)!
    85‚Üí        components.queryItems = [
    86‚Üí            URLQueryItem(name: "student_id", value: studentId),
    87‚Üí            URLQueryItem(name: "page", value: String(page)),
    88‚Üí            URLQueryItem(name: "limit", value: String(limit))
    89‚Üí        ]
    90‚Üí
    91‚Üí        if let trainerId {
    92‚Üí            components.queryItems?.append(URLQueryItem(name: "trainer_id", value: trainerId))
    93‚Üí        }
    94‚Üí
    95‚Üí        guard let url = components.url else {
    96‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.invalidURL
    97‚Üí        }
    98‚Üí
    99‚Üí        let request = try buildRequest(url: url, method: "GET")
   100‚Üí        return try await execute(request: request)
   101‚Üí    }
   102‚Üí
   103‚Üí    /// Fetches a single workout by ID.
   104‚Üí    ///
   105‚Üí    /// - Parameter id: The workout ID.
   106‚Üí    /// - Returns: The workout details.
   107‚Üí    /// - Throws: CMSServiceError if the request fails.
   108‚Üí    func fetchWorkout(id: String) async throws -> CMSWorkout {
   109‚Üí        let url = configuration.baseURL.appendingPathComponent("/api/workouts/\(id)")
   110‚Üí        let request = try buildRequest(url: url, method: "GET")
   111‚Üí        return try await execute(request: request)
   112‚Üí    }
   113‚Üí
   114‚Üí    /// Updates a workout's status or metadata.
   115‚Üí    ///
   116‚Üí    /// - Parameters:
   117‚Üí    ///   - id: The workout ID.
   118‚Üí    ///   - update: The update request body.
   119‚Üí    /// - Returns: The updated workout.
   120‚Üí    /// - Throws: CMSServiceError if the request fails.
   121‚Üí    func updateWorkout(id: String, update: CMSWorkoutUpdateRequest) async throws -> CMSWorkout {
   122‚Üí        let url = configuration.baseURL.appendingPathComponent("/api/workouts/\(id)")
   123‚Üí        var request = try buildRequest(url: url, method: "PATCH")
   124‚Üí        request.httpBody = try encoder.encode(update)
   125‚Üí        return try await execute(request: request)
   126‚Üí    }
   127‚Üí
   128‚Üí    /// Marks a workout as deleted (soft delete).
   129‚Üí    ///
   130‚Üí    /// - Parameter id: The workout ID.
   131‚Üí    /// - Throws: CMSServiceError if the request fails.
   132‚Üí    func deleteWorkout(id: String) async throws {
   133‚Üí        let url = configuration.baseURL.appendingPathComponent("/api/workouts/\(id)")
   134‚Üí        let request = try buildRequest(url: url, method: "DELETE")
   135‚Üí        let _: EmptyResponse = try await execute(request: request)
   136‚Üí    }
   137‚Üí
   138‚Üí    // MARK: - Progress API
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üí    /// Fetches the student's progress for a workout.
   141‚Üí    ///
   142‚Üí    /// - Parameter workoutId: The workout ID.
   143‚Üí    /// - Returns: The progress data.
   144‚Üí    /// - Throws: CMSServiceError if the request fails.
   145‚Üí    func fetchProgress(workoutId: String) async throws -> CMSWorkoutProgress {
   146‚Üí        let url = configuration.baseURL.appendingPathComponent("/api/workouts/\(workoutId)/progress")
   147‚Üí        let request = try buildRequest(url: url, method: "GET")
   148‚Üí        return try await execute(request: request)
   149‚Üí    }
   150‚Üí
   151‚Üí    // MARK: - Feedback API
   152‚Üí
   153‚Üí    /// Fetches all feedback for a workout.
   154‚Üí    ///
   155‚Üí    /// - Parameter workoutId: The workout ID.
   156‚Üí    /// - Returns: An array of feedback items.
   157‚Üí    /// - Throws: CMSServiceError if the request fails.
   158‚Üí    func fetchFeedback(workoutId: String) async throws -> [CMSWorkoutFeedback] {
   159‚Üí        let url = configuration.baseURL.appendingPathComponent("/api/workouts/\(workoutId)/feedback")
   160‚Üí        let request = try buildRequest(url: url, method: "GET")
   161‚Üí        return try await execute(request: request)
   162‚Üí    }
   163‚Üí
   164‚Üí    /// Posts new feedback for a workout.
   165‚Üí    ///
   166‚Üí    /// - Parameters:
   167‚Üí    ///   - workoutId: The workout ID.
   168‚Üí    ///   - feedback: The feedback request body.
   169‚Üí    /// - Returns: The created feedback.
   170‚Üí    /// - Throws: CMSServiceError if the request fails.
   171‚Üí    func postFeedback(workoutId: String, feedback: CMSFeedbackRequest) async throws -> CMSWorkoutFeedback {
   172‚Üí        let url = configuration.baseURL.appendingPathComponent("/api/workouts/\(workoutId)/feedback")
   173‚Üí        var request = try buildRequest(url: url, method: "POST")
   174‚Üí        request.httpBody = try encoder.encode(feedback)
   175‚Üí        return try await execute(request: request)
   176‚Üí    }
   177‚Üí
   178‚Üí    // MARK: - Private Helpers
   179‚Üí
   180‚Üí    private func buildRequest(url: URL, method: String) throws -> URLRequest {
   181‚Üí        var request = URLRequest(url: url)
   182‚Üí        request.httpMethod = method
   183‚Üí        request.setValue("application/json", forHTTPHeaderField: "Content-Type")
   184‚Üí        request.setValue("application/json", forHTTPHeaderField: "Accept")
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí        if let apiKey = configuration.apiKey {
   187‚Üí            request.setValue("Bearer \(apiKey)", forHTTPHeaderField: "Authorization")
   188‚Üí        }
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí        return request
   191‚Üí    }
   192‚Üí
   193‚Üí    private func execute<T: Decodable>(request: URLRequest) async throws -> T {
   194‚Üí        #if DEBUG
   195‚Üí        print("[CMSWorkoutService] \(request.httpMethod ?? "GET") \(request.url?.absoluteString ?? "")")
   196‚Üí        #endif
   197‚Üí
   198‚Üí        let (data, response) = try await session.data(for: request)
   199‚Üí
   200‚Üí        guard let httpResponse = response as? HTTPURLResponse else {
   201‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.invalidResponse
   202‚Üí        }
   203‚Üí
   204‚Üí        #if DEBUG
   205‚Üí        print("[CMSWorkoutService] Status: \(httpResponse.statusCode)")
   206‚Üí        #endif
   207‚Üí
   208‚Üí        switch httpResponse.statusCode {
   209‚Üí        case 200...299:
   210‚Üí            do {
   211‚Üí                return try decoder.decode(T.self, from: data)
   212‚Üí            } catch {
   213‚Üí                #if DEBUG
   214‚Üí                print("[CMSWorkoutService] Decode error: \(error)")
   215‚Üí                if let json = String(data: data, encoding: .utf8) {
   216‚Üí                    print("[CMSWorkoutService] Response: \(json.prefix(500))")
   217‚Üí                }
   218‚Üí                #endif
   219‚Üí                throw CMSServiceError.decodingFailed(error)
   220‚Üí            }
   221‚Üí
   222‚Üí        case 401:
   223‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.unauthorized
   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí        case 403:
   226‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.forbidden
   227‚Üí
   228‚Üí        case 404:
   229‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.notFound
   230‚Üí
   231‚Üí        case 429:
   232‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.rateLimited
   233‚Üí
   234‚Üí        case 500...599:
   235‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.serverError(httpResponse.statusCode)
   236‚Üí
   237‚Üí        default:
   238‚Üí            if let apiError = try? decoder.decode(CMSAPIError.self, from: data) {
   239‚Üí                throw CMSServiceError.apiError(apiError)
   240‚Üí            }
   241‚Üí            throw CMSServiceError.unexpectedStatus(httpResponse.statusCode)
   242‚Üí        }
   243‚Üí    }
   244‚Üí}
   245‚Üí
   246‚Üí// MARK: - Empty Response
   247‚Üí
   248‚Üí/// Used for endpoints that return no body on success.
   249‚Üíprivate struct EmptyResponse: Decodable {}
   250‚Üí
   251‚Üí// MARK: - CMS Service Error
   252‚Üí
   253‚Üí/// Errors that can occur during CMS API operations.
   254‚Üíenum CMSServiceError: LocalizedError, Sendable {
   255‚Üí    case invalidURL
   256‚Üí    case invalidResponse
   257‚Üí    case unauthorized
   258‚Üí    case forbidden
   259‚Üí    case notFound
   260‚Üí    case rateLimited
   261‚Üí    case serverError(Int)
   262‚Üí    case unexpectedStatus(Int)
   263‚Üí    case decodingFailed(Error)
   264‚Üí    case apiError(CMSAPIError)
   265‚Üí    case networkError(Error)
   266‚Üí
   267‚Üí    var errorDescription: String? {
   268‚Üí        switch self {
   269‚Üí        case .invalidURL:
   270‚Üí            return "URL invalida"
   271‚Üí        case .invalidResponse:
   272‚Üí            return "Resposta invalida do servidor"
   273‚Üí        case .unauthorized:
   274‚Üí            return "Sessao expirada. Faca login novamente."
   275‚Üí        case .forbidden:
   276‚Üí            return "Voce nao tem permissao para acessar este recurso"
   277‚Üí        case .notFound:
   278‚Üí            return "Treino nao encontrado"
   279‚Üí        case .rateLimited:
   280‚Üí            return "Muitas requisicoes. Aguarde um momento."
   281‚Üí        case .serverError(let code):
   282‚Üí            return "Erro no servidor (\(code)). Tente novamente."
   283‚Üí        case .unexpectedStatus(let code):
   284‚Üí            return "Erro inesperado (\(code))"
   285‚Üí        case .decodingFailed:
   286‚Üí            return "Erro ao processar resposta"

**File Path:** `/Users/viniciuscarvalho/Documents/FitToday/FitToday/FitToday/Domain/Protocols/CMSWorkoutRepository.swift`

- Methods for updating workout status and archiving

### 3. CMS Data Models (Data/Models)

**File Path:** `/Users/viniciuscarvalho/Documents/FitToday/FitToday/FitToday/Data/Models/CMSWorkoutModels.swift`

- `CMSWorkout` - Individual workout with phases and items
- `CMSWorkoutPhase` - Workout phases/sections
- `CMSWorkoutItem` - Individual exercises with sets, reps, weight, rest
- `CMSWorkoutSchedule` - Schedule configuration
- `CMSWorkoutProgress` - Progress tracking (sessions, exercise progress)
- `CMSWorkoutFeedback` - Feedback with type (general, difficulty, exercise, completion, question)
- `CMSFeedbackType` enum with 5 types
- API request/response models

### 4. CMS Service Implementation

**File Path:** `/Users/viniciuscarvalho/Documents/FitToday/FitToday/FitToday/Data/Services/CMS/CMSWorkoutService.swift`

**Key Features:**
- Actor-based service (thread-safe)
- Base URL: `https://api.fittoday.app`
- Supports endpoints: `/api/workouts`, `/api/workouts/[id]`, `/api/workouts/[id]/progress`, `/api/workouts/[id]/feedback`
- HTTP methods: GET, PATCH, DELETE, POST

### 5. CMS Repository Implementation

**File Path:** `/Users/viniciuscarvalho/Documents/FitToday/FitToday/FitToday/Data/Repositories/CMSWorkoutRepositoryImpl.swift`

**Key Content:**
- Concrete implementation of `CMSWorkoutRepository`
- Uses `CMSWorkoutService` for API calls
- Uses `CMSWorkoutMapper` for DTO to domain conversion

### 6. TabRootView.swift (Navigation)

**File Path:** `/Users/viniciuscarvalho/Documents/FitToday/FitToday/FitToday/Presentation/Root/TabRootView.swift`

**Key Features:**
- Uses `@Environment(AppRouter.self)` for navigation
- Tab-based navigation with 5 tabs: home, workout, create, activity, profile

- Relevant routes include:
  - `.personalTrainer` ‚Üí `PersonalTrainerView`

### 7. AppContainer.swift (DI Registration)

**File Path:** `/Users/viniciuscarvalho/Documents/FitToday/FitToday/FitToday/Presentation/DI/AppContainer.swift`

**CMS Services Registration (Lines 540-606):**
```swift
// CMSWorkoutService - REST API client

}

- FetchCMSWorkoutDetailUseCase
- FetchWorkoutProgressUseCase
- FetchWorkoutFeedbackUseCase
- PostWorkoutFeedbackUseCase
- CompleteCMSWorkoutUseCase
- ArchiveCMSWorkoutUseCase
```

### 8. PersonalWorkoutsListView.swift

**File Path:** `/Users/viniciuscarvalho/Documents/FitToday/FitToday/FitToday/Presentation/Features/PersonalWorkouts/Views/PersonalWorkoutsListView.swift`

**Key Features:**

1‚Üí//
     2‚Üí//  PersonalTrainerModels.swift
     3‚Üí//  FitToday
     4‚Üí//
     5‚Üí//  Created by Claude on 04/02/26.
     6‚Üí//
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíimport Foundation
     9‚Üí
    10‚Üí// MARK: - Personal Trainer
    11‚Üí
    12‚Üí/// Represents a personal trainer in the CMS integration system.
    13‚Üí///
    14‚Üí/// Personal trainers can create workout plans through the CMS portal and
    15‚Üí/// connect with students (app users) to deliver personalized training programs.
    16‚Üístruct PersonalTrainer: Sendable, Identifiable, Hashable, Codable {
    17‚Üí    /// Unique identifier for the trainer (Firebase UID).
    18‚Üí    let id: String
    19‚Üí
    20‚Üí    /// Display name shown to students.
    21‚Üí    var displayName: String
    22‚Üí
    23‚Üí    /// Trainer's email address.
    24‚Üí    var email: String
    25‚Üí
    26‚Üí    /// URL to the trainer's profile photo.
    27‚Üí    var photoURL: URL?
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí    /// Areas of expertise (e.g., "strength", "weight_loss", "flexibility").
    30‚Üí    var specializations: [String]
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí    /// Short biography or description.
    33‚Üí    var bio: String?
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí    /// Whether the trainer is currently accepting new students.
    36‚Üí    var isActive: Bool
    37‚Üí
    38‚Üí    /// Unique invite code students can use to connect.
    39‚Üí    var inviteCode: String?
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí    /// Maximum number of students this trainer can manage.
    42‚Üí    var maxStudents: Int
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí    /// Current number of connected students.
    45‚Üí    var currentStudentCount: Int
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí    /// Whether the trainer can accept more students.
    48‚Üí    var canAcceptStudents: Bool {
    49‚Üí        isActive && currentStudentCount < maxStudents
    50‚Üí    }
    51‚Üí}
    52‚Üí
    53‚Üí// MARK: - Trainer Student Relationship
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üí/// Represents the connection between a personal trainer and a student.
    56‚Üí///
    57‚Üí/// This relationship tracks the lifecycle from initial request through
    58‚Üí/// active training to potential cancellation.
    59‚Üístruct TrainerStudentRelationship: Sendable, Identifiable, Hashable, Codable {
    60‚Üí    /// Unique identifier for this relationship.
    61‚Üí    let id: String
    62‚Üí
    63‚Üí    /// The personal trainer's identifier.
    64‚Üí    let trainerId: String
    65‚Üí
    66‚Üí    /// The student's identifier (app user).
    67‚Üí    let studentId: String
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí    /// Current status of the connection.
    70‚Üí    var status: TrainerConnectionStatus
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üí    /// Who initiated the connection request.
    73‚Üí    let requestedBy: RequestedBy
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí    /// When the connection was requested.
    76‚Üí    let requestedAt: Date
    77‚Üí
    78‚Üí    /// When the connection was accepted (nil if still pending).
    79‚Üí    var acceptedAt: Date?
    80‚Üí
    81‚Üí    /// Current subscription status for this relationship.
    82‚Üí    var subscriptionStatus: TrainerSubscriptionStatus
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí    /// When the subscription expires (nil for unlimited).
    85‚Üí    var subscriptionExpiresAt: Date?
    86‚Üí
    87‚Üí    /// Whether the relationship is currently active and valid.
    88‚Üí    var isValid: Bool {
    89‚Üí        status == .active && (subscriptionStatus == .active || subscriptionStatus == .trial)
    90‚Üí    }
    91‚Üí}
    92‚Üí
    93‚Üí// MARK: - Connection Status
    94‚Üí
    95‚Üí/// Status of the trainer-student connection.
    96‚Üíenum TrainerConnectionStatus: String, Sendable, CaseIterable, Codable {
    97‚Üí    /// Connection request is pending approval.
    98‚Üí    case pending
    99‚Üí
   100‚Üí    /// Connection is active and trainer can assign workouts.
   101‚Üí    case active
   102‚Üí
   103‚Üí    /// Connection is temporarily paused.
   104‚Üí    case paused
   105‚Üí
   106‚Üí    /// Connection has been cancelled by either party.
   107‚Üí    case cancelled
   108‚Üí}
   109‚Üí
   110‚Üí// MARK: - Subscription Status
   111‚Üí
   112‚Üí/// Subscription status for the trainer-student relationship.
   113‚Üíenum TrainerSubscriptionStatus: String, Sendable, CaseIterable, Codable {
   114‚Üí    /// Student is in trial period.
   115‚Üí    case trial
   116‚Üí
   117‚Üí    /// Subscription is active and paid.
   118‚Üí    case active
   119‚Üí
   120‚Üí    /// Subscription has expired.
   121‚Üí    case expired
   122‚Üí}
   123‚Üí
   124‚Üí// MARK: - Request Initiator
   125‚Üí
   126‚Üí/// Who initiated the trainer-student connection request.
   127‚Üíenum RequestedBy: String, Sendable, CaseIterable, Codable {
   128‚Üí    /// Student requested connection with trainer.
   129‚Üí    case student
   130‚Üí
   131‚Üí    /// Trainer invited the student.
   132‚Üí    case trainer
   133‚Üí}
   134‚Üí
   135‚Üí// MARK: - Trainer Workout
   136‚Üí
   137‚Üí/// Represents a workout assigned by a personal trainer to a student.
   138‚Üí///
   139‚Üí/// This is a domain model that wraps trainer-created workout data with
   140‚Üí/// attribution and scheduling information. It can be converted to a
   141‚Üí/// `WorkoutPlan` for execution in the app.
   142‚Üístruct TrainerWorkout: Sendable, Identifiable, Hashable, Codable {
   143‚Üí    /// Unique identifier for this workout.
   144‚Üí    let id: String
   145‚Üí
   146‚Üí    /// The trainer who created this workout.
   147‚Üí    let trainerId: String
   148‚Üí
   149‚Üí    /// Workout title/name.
   150‚Üí    var title: String
   151‚Üí
   152‚Üí    /// Optional description of the workout.
   153‚Üí    var description: String?
   154‚Üí
   155‚Üí    /// Focus area of the workout.
   156‚Üí    var focus: DailyFocus

1‚Üí//
     2‚Üí//  CMSWorkoutMapper.swift
     3‚Üí//  FitToday
     4‚Üí//
     5‚Üí//  Maps CMS API DTOs to domain models.
     6‚Üí//
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíimport Foundation
     9‚Üí
    10‚Üí// MARK: - CMS Workout Mapper
    11‚Üí
    12‚Üí/// Converts CMS API DTOs to domain models.
    13‚Üí///
    14‚Üí/// Handles the transformation of workout data from the CMS REST API
    15‚Üí/// format to the app's domain model format.
    16‚Üíenum CMSWorkoutMapper {
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí    // MARK: - CMS to Domain
    19‚Üí
    20‚Üí    /// Converts a CMS workout DTO to a domain TrainerWorkout.
    21‚Üí    ///
    22‚Üí    /// - Parameter cms: The CMS workout DTO.
    23‚Üí    /// - Returns: A domain TrainerWorkout model.
    24‚Üí    static func toDomain(_ cms: CMSWorkout) -> TrainerWorkout {
    25‚Üí        TrainerWorkout(
    26‚Üí            id: cms.id,
    27‚Üí            trainerId: cms.trainerId,
    28‚Üí            title: cms.title,
    29‚Üí            description: cms.description,
    30‚Üí            focus: mapFocus(cms.focus),
    31‚Üí            estimatedDurationMinutes: cms.estimatedDurationMinutes,
    32‚Üí            intensity: mapIntensity(cms.intensity),
    33‚Üí            phases: cms.phases.map(mapPhase),
    34‚Üí            schedule: mapSchedule(cms.schedule),
    35‚Üí            isActive: cms.status == .active,
    36‚Üí            createdAt: cms.createdAt,
    37‚Üí            version: cms.version
    38‚Üí        )
    39‚Üí    }
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí    /// Converts a CMS workout to an executable WorkoutPlan.
    42‚Üí    ///
    43‚Üí    /// - Parameter cms: The CMS workout DTO.
    44‚Üí    /// - Returns: A WorkoutPlan ready for workout execution.
    45‚Üí    static func toWorkoutPlan(_ cms: CMSWorkout) -> WorkoutPlan {
    46‚Üí        let trainerWorkout = toDomain(cms)
    47‚Üí        return toWorkoutPlan(from: trainerWorkout)
    48‚Üí    }
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí    /// Converts a TrainerWorkout domain model to a WorkoutPlan.
    51‚Üí    ///
    52‚Üí    /// - Parameter workout: The TrainerWorkout domain model.
    53‚Üí    /// - Returns: A WorkoutPlan ready for workout execution.
    54‚Üí    static func toWorkoutPlan(from workout: TrainerWorkout) -> WorkoutPlan {
    55‚Üí        let phases = workout.phases.map { phase -> WorkoutPlanPhase in
    56‚Üí            let items: [WorkoutPlanItem] = phase.items.map { item in
    57‚Üí                let exercise = WorkoutExercise(
    58‚Üí                    id: item.exerciseId.map { String($0) } ?? UUID().uuidString,
    59‚Üí                    name: item.exerciseName,
    60‚Üí                    mainMuscle: mapMuscleGroup(from: workout.focus),
    61‚Üí                    equipment: .bodyweight,
    62‚Üí                    instructions: item.notes.map { [$0] } ?? [],
    63‚Üí                    media: nil
    64‚Üí                )
    65‚Üí
    66‚Üí                let prescription = ExercisePrescription(
    67‚Üí                    exercise: exercise,
    68‚Üí                    sets: item.sets,
    69‚Üí                    reps: item.reps,
    70‚Üí                    restInterval: TimeInterval(item.restSeconds),
    71‚Üí                    tip: item.notes
    72‚Üí                )
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí                return .exercise(prescription)
    75‚Üí            }
    76‚Üí
    77‚Üí            return WorkoutPlanPhase(
    78‚Üí                kind: mapPhaseKind(phase.name),
    79‚Üí                title: phase.name,
    80‚Üí                rpeTarget: nil,
    81‚Üí                items: items
    82‚Üí            )
    83‚Üí        }
    84‚Üí
    85‚Üí        return WorkoutPlan(
    86‚Üí            id: UUID(),
    87‚Üí            title: workout.title,
    88‚Üí            focus: workout.focus,
    89‚Üí            estimatedDurationMinutes: workout.estimatedDurationMinutes,
    90‚Üí            intensity: workout.intensity,
    91‚Üí            phases: phases,
    92‚Üí            createdAt: workout.createdAt
    93‚Üí        )
    94‚Üí    }
    95‚Üí
    96‚Üí    // MARK: - Private Helpers
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí    private static func mapFocus(_ focus: String) -> DailyFocus {
    99‚Üí        switch focus.lowercased() {
   100‚Üí        case "fullbody", "full_body", "full-body", "corpo todo":
   101‚Üí            return .fullBody
   102‚Üí        case "upper", "upper_body", "upper-body", "superior":
   103‚Üí            return .upper
   104‚Üí        case "lower", "lower_body", "lower-body", "inferior":
   105‚Üí            return .lower
   106‚Üí        case "cardio", "aerobico":
   107‚Üí            return .cardio
   108‚Üí        case "core", "abdomen":
   109‚Üí            return .core
   110‚Üí        case "push":
   111‚Üí            return .upper
   112‚Üí        case "pull":
   113‚Üí            return .upper
   114‚Üí        case "legs":
   115‚Üí            return .lower
   116‚Üí        default:
   117‚Üí            return .surprise
   118‚Üí        }
   119‚Üí    }
   120‚Üí
   121‚Üí    private static func mapIntensity(_ intensity: String) -> WorkoutIntensity {
   122‚Üí        switch intensity.lowercased() {
   123‚Üí        case "low", "baixa", "leve":
   124‚Üí            return .low
   125‚Üí        case "moderate", "medium", "moderada", "media":
   126‚Üí            return .moderate
   127‚Üí        case "high", "alta", "intensa":
   128‚Üí            return .high
   129‚Üí        default:
   130‚Üí            return .moderate
   131‚Üí        }
   132‚Üí    }
   133‚Üí
   134‚Üí    private static func mapPhase(_ phase: CMSWorkoutPhase) -> TrainerWorkoutPhase {
   135‚Üí        TrainerWorkoutPhase(
   136‚Üí            name: phase.name,
   137‚Üí            items: phase.items.map(mapItem)
   138‚Üí        )
   139‚Üí    }
   140‚Üí
   141‚Üí    private static func mapItem(_ item: CMSWorkoutItem) -> TrainerWorkoutItem {
   142‚Üí        TrainerWorkoutItem(
   143‚Üí            exerciseId: item.exerciseId,
   144‚Üí            exerciseName: item.exerciseName,
   145‚Üí            sets: item.sets,
   146‚Üí            reps: parseReps(item.reps),
   147‚Üí            restSeconds: item.restSeconds,
   148‚Üí            notes: item.notes
   149‚Üí        )
   150‚Üí    }
   151‚Üí
   152‚Üí    private static func parseReps(_ reps: String) -> IntRange {
   153‚Üí        let trimmed = reps.trimmingCharacters(in: .whitespaces)
   154‚Üí
   155‚Üí        if trimmed.contains("-") {
   156‚Üí            let parts = trimmed.split(separator: "-")
   157‚Üí            if parts.count == 2,
   158‚Üí               let lower = Int(parts[0].trimmingCharacters(in: .whitespaces)),
   159‚Üí               let upper = Int(parts[1].trimmingCharacters(in: .whitespaces)) {
   160‚Üí                return IntRange(lower, upper)
   161‚Üí            }
   162‚Üí        }
   163‚Üí
   164‚Üí        if let single = Int(trimmed) {
   165‚Üí            return IntRange(single, single)
   166‚Üí        }
   167‚Üí
   168‚Üí        return IntRange(10, 12)
   169‚Üí    }
   170‚Üí
   171‚Üí    private static func mapSchedule(_ schedule: CMSWorkoutSchedule?) -> TrainerWorkoutSchedule {
   172‚Üí        guard let schedule else {
   173‚Üí            return TrainerWorkoutSchedule(type: .once, scheduledDate: nil, dayOfWeek: nil)
   174‚Üí        }
   175‚Üí
   176‚Üí        let type: TrainerWorkoutScheduleType
   177‚Üí        switch schedule.type.lowercased() {
   178‚Üí        case "once", "single":
   179‚Üí            type = .once
   180‚Üí        case "recurring", "repeat":
   181‚Üí            type = .recurring
   182‚Üí        case "weekly", "semanal":
   183‚Üí            type = .weekly
   184‚Üí        default:
   185‚Üí            type = .once
   186‚Üí        }
   187‚Üí
   188‚Üí        return TrainerWorkoutSchedule(
   189‚Üí            type: type,
   190‚Üí            scheduledDate: schedule.scheduledDate,
   191‚Üí            dayOfWeek: schedule.dayOfWeek
   192‚Üí        )
   193‚Üí    }
   194‚Üí
   195‚Üí    private static func mapPhaseKind(_ name: String) -> WorkoutPlanPhase.Kind {
   196‚Üí        let normalized = name.lowercased()
   197‚Üí
   198‚Üí        if normalized.contains("warmup") || normalized.contains("aquecimento") {
   199‚Üí            return .warmup
   200‚Üí        }
   201‚Üí        if normalized.contains("strength") || normalized.contains("for√ßa") || normalized.contains("principal") {
   202‚Üí            return .strength
   203‚Üí        }
   204‚Üí        if normalized.contains("accessory") || normalized.contains("acess√≥rio") || normalized.contains("complementar") {
   205‚Üí            return .accessory
   206‚Üí        }
   207‚Üí        if normalized.contains("conditioning") || normalized.contains("condicionamento") {
   208‚Üí            return .conditioning
   209‚Üí        }
   210‚Üí        if normalized.contains("aerobic") || normalized.contains("aer√≥bico") || normalized.contains("cardio") {
   211‚Üí            return .aerobic
   212‚Üí        }
   213‚Üí        if normalized.contains("finisher") || normalized.contains("finalizador") {
   214‚Üí            return .finisher
   215‚Üí        }
   216‚Üí        if normalized.contains("cooldown") || normalized.contains("volta √† calma") || normalized.contains("alongamento") {
   217‚Üí            return .cooldown
   218‚Üí        }
   219‚Üí
   220‚Üí        return .strength
   221‚Üí    }
   222‚Üí
   223‚Üí    private static func mapMuscleGroup(from focus: DailyFocus) -> MuscleGroup {
   224‚Üí        switch focus {
   225‚Üí        case .fullBody:
   226‚Üí            return .fullBody
   227‚Üí        case .upper:
   228‚Üí            return .chest
   229‚Üí        case .lower:
   230‚Üí            return .quadriceps
   231‚Üí        case .cardio:
   232‚Üí            return .fullBody
   233‚Üí        case .core:
   234‚Üí            return .core
   235‚Üí        case .surprise:
   236‚Üí            return .fullBody
   237‚Üí        }
   238‚Üí    }
   239‚Üí}
